page.title: 03Home life Exbourne
page.content: I live at Coxwell Farm, which was mentioned in the first Domesday Book.This is a day in my life. I get up at 7.45 and get ready for school,while dad is doing the milking.While Janet and I are at school,dad works on the farm,mum does the housework,my sister Helen works in a shop in Okehampton. When I get home I change and go to feed the Guinea pigs and rabbits.I let out my Bantams.They are like small hens,they lay two to four eggs a day.Some are black, one is ginger, three are grey.I also have a Silver Dorking cockerel and seven chicks. When dad comes in from mending hedges or making silage,we have our tea.Dad milks the cows again while we play or watch television.I lock up the hens against the fox. Then I go to bed and read for a while before I go to sleep.
